props.text: There is a bus down the street. The price is quite affordable

Are you heading to the city center!
I got the best price!
Hi, I need to go to the downtown

No problem.
That will be 50 coins, please

Hmmm...
What is "new kid on the block"?
props.ans4: The newest person in a group

props.text: Try to find all the idioms on this level

I got this hat from my father.
And he got it from his father

I'm a good driver. I had only 5 accidents
...
This year
Oh. I think  that’s too expensive for me

You're a new kid on the block, right?
It's the lowest price around
Thank you!
"New kid on the block" is a newcomer, the newest person in a group

KEEP CALM
and
BUY A
BALLOON!

Oh my god!
YOU are HERE!!!

Hey!
I'm pulling your leg.
It's just a costume
Oh I see…
What does "I'm pulling your leg" mean...?
props.ans4: I'm using the Force to pull your leg

props.text:
KEEP CALM
and
BUY A
BALLOON!
I've got the power!

Come to the
Dark Side!
We have balloons!

I'm saving money to build another
Death Star

Come to the
Dark Side!
We have balloons!
Funny! But wrong, try again
"To pull someone's leg" means to joke with it!
Hot kebab! Hot kebab!
Mommy told me you made it from cats sometimes
Put a sock in it!
“Put a sock in it” means
props.ans1: Put a sock in the kebab!

props.text: Hot kebab! Hot kebab!

Fresh kebab!
It’s made from the best lamb meat
It’s the best meat in the city!
I am a liar...
I can make ten kebabs in one minute!

My boy wants to be an ice cream seller.
What a shame!
"Put a sock in it" means a request to be quiet
Foxy is a journalist. She’s arrived in London to collect English idioms and slang words
Talk to London people and when they use an idiom or a slang word, try to guess the right meaning of it!
Hello, Mr. Policeman!
What do you want?
Could you tell me how can I get to the city center?
It's a piece of cake. Just go forward...

What could
"piece of cake"
mean?

It was the first idiom on the level!

Talk to people, guess and learn all the 5 idioms!
Let's start our journey. Get closer to the policeman and ask the way to the city center.

Nothing to do?
Get a job!
I don't like the smell of foxes
Stop pestering me or I'll arrest you!

You've just collected a coin!

Find 5 coins to buy a bus ticket to the next level
Looks like an idiom!
Foxy is a journalist. She’s arrived in London to collect English idioms and slang words. Now press the right arrow to continue.
"Piece of cake" means something very easy!
The Ferris wheel is free to enter, Foxy!
Life is like that Ferris wheel; it goes up and down, round and round...
..and it can take your breath away!
"Take your breath away" means…
The Ferris wheel is free to enter, Foxy!

Some people say that the Ferris wheel is too fast. 
Want to check?
Sometimes I worry about woodpeckers because of my wooden leg
Yo-ho-ho, and a bottle of rum!
"Take someone's breath away" means to extremely surprise and amaze it!
You need to have 5 coins to buy a bus ticket
I see you have enough coins to buy the ticket
So I can't let you get on the bus
The bus is leaving now

props.text:
But look...
Here are the brand new glasses!

What a mess here...
:(

You've just found a secret!

There is one for each level. Be curious and find cool things!
